Description: A cup of micaceous, red siltware pottery; with a shallow pointed base and flared rim. The exterior was covered with a red slip, part of which has worn off; this slip was carried over onto the interior of the rim.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Possibly from "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: See also London, BM, EA 23701 and the comment concerning its findspot.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64, 65 § 61, pl. xxxv, 47)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.102, p.191, pl.33)
